About Me

Still here? Impressive! What do you think of the photo carousel on the right? A bit off, right? It's not the best, but now you know I can handle code on my website. Plus, you've seen my face - pretty nerdy, huh? What else do you expect from a Web Developer! You might gather I enjoy travelling, meaning I prefer REMOTE positions. But hey, I'm open to the office a few days a month or year.

In a different era, I was outgoing, cheerful, and passionate. I worked as a tourist guide in London for over five years, showing happy tourists the city's history. Yet, the daily interaction took a toll. In 2018, I made the tough decision to change careers, from people to computers. Now, I'm the opposite of what I was, but machines don't judge, right ChatGPT?

Started as a software tester - dull, monotonous. However, I gained insights into the industry dynamics: project managers, clients, Agile, Scrum, Front-End, Back-End, OOP, responsiveness and so on. Testing wasn't my forte. Former colleagues suggested working on their WordPress site, and that's when the spark of love for development ignited. The pandemic provided ample time to study, practice, break websites, fix them, and break them again.

Since then, I've worked both independently and in teams, continuously learning, staying updated, and hoping AI won't snatch my job. Curious for more? Did you only read Web Developer and Front-End? Keep scrolling down..
